org.magiclib.bounty

Class ActiveBounty

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.magiclib.bounty.ActiveBounty

  • public final class ActiveBounty
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a bounty that has been at least viewed by the player. Can be considered an inflated/instantiated version of MagicBountySpec.
    Author:
    Wisp

    • Constructor Detail

      • ActiveBounty

        public ActiveBounty(@NotNull
                    @NotNull java.lang.String bountyKey,
                    @NotNull
                    @NotNull com.fs.starfarer.api.campaign.CampaignFleetAPI fleet,
                    @NotNull
                    @NotNull com.fs.starfarer.api.campaign.SectorEntityToken fleetSpawnLocation,
                    @NotNull
                    @NotNull java.util.List<java.lang.String> presetShipIds,
                    @NotNull
                    @NotNull MagicBountySpec spec)
        Parameters:
        bountyKey - A unique key for the bounty, as used by [MagicBountyCoordinator].
        fleet - The fleet that, when destroyed, completes the bounty. Should have no location to start with. The fleet's location will be set when the bounty is accepted (from fleetSpawnLocation).
        fleetSpawnLocation - The location to spawn the fleet when the bounty is accepted.
        presetShipIds - Ships that should always be added, if fleet DP allows.
        spec - The original bounty spec, a mirror of the json definition.

    • Method Detail

      • acceptBounty

        public void acceptBounty(@NotNull
                         @NotNull com.fs.starfarer.api.campaign.SectorEntityToken bountySource,
                         @Nullable
                         @Nullable java.lang.Float rewardCredits,
                         @Nullable
                         @Nullable java.lang.Float rewardReputation,
                         @Nullable
                         @Nullable java.lang.String rewardFaction)
        Call when the player accepts a bounty.
        - Spawns the bounty fleet.
        - Adds Intel to the Intel Manager.
        Parameters:
        bountySource - From where the bounty was accepted from.
        rewardCredits - The number of credits to give as a reward. Null or zero if no reward.

      • endBounty

        public void endBounty(@NotNull
                      @NotNull ActiveBounty.BountyResult result)
        Finishes the bounty with the provided result. Idempotent (if called more than once with the same result or has already ended, will not trigger again).
        - Updates intel.
        Parameters:
        result - The final result of the bounty.

      • getDaysRemainingToComplete

        @NotNull
public @NotNull java.lang.Float getDaysRemainingToComplete()
        Returns:
        Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY if there is no time limit or quest hasn't been accepted.

      • getFailureReputationPenalty

        @Nullable
public @Nullable java.lang.Float getFailureReputationPenalty()
        Rep penalty is the inverse of the reward, capped to -0.05. Or, if rep reward is negative, the rep penalty will be 0.

      • getIntel

        @Nullable
public @Nullable MagicBountyIntel getIntel()
        The [MagicBountyIntel] active for this bounty, if there is any.
        There will only be intel if the bounty has been accepted (and isn't long past ended).
